intro: Houstonia brandegeeana, commonly known as the pink bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. It has a short stem with whorled leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Houstonia brandegeeana is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in early spring.
